name: Easy Problem
statement: Cube is given an integer $$$n$$$. She wants to know how many ordered pairs of positive integers $$$(a,b)$$$ there are such that $$$a=n-b$$$. Since Cube is not very good at math, please help her!
inputFormat: The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 99$$$) â€” the number of test cases. The only line of each test case contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \leq n \leq 100$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output the number of ordered pairs $$$(a, b)$$$ on a new line.
